description: Borrowed from Serbo-Croatian rakija/ракија, from Ottoman Turkish راقی‎ (rakı), assumed from Arabic عَرَق‎ (ʕaraq, “sweat; wine”) (as rakija or wine vapor drops are similar to drops of sweat). Doublet of raki.

entries.meaning: A strong distilled alcoholic beverage made from various fruits, varieties of which (such as slivovitz) are found across the Balkans and the Mediterranean.
